card.trusted_txt: In which any benefits are offered and nothing is held back from work.
card.trusted_txt2: Some desire to enjoy training with pleasure. But the result is painful. As a consequence, the one responsible is at fault for seeking comfort but experiencing discomfort. And yet the result brings satisfaction.

card.trusted_txt: In an environment that values progress, every tool is available for success.
card.trusted_txt2: Some wish for an easy path to improvement. However, growth often comes with struggle. Those who avoid discomfort may miss out on the rewards that perseverance brings.

card.trusted_txt: In a culture that encourages excellence, nothing is withheld from achievement.
card.trusted_txt2: Some hope to advance without effort. Yet, the road to success is often challenging. Embracing the discomfort of growth leads to lasting satisfaction.

card.trusted_txt: In a setting committed to success, all support is readily provided.
card.trusted_txt2: Some prefer to learn in comfort. But the reality is that true progress often requires sacrifice. Ultimately, the challenges faced pave the way for genuine achievement.

Guidelines.title: Eligibility
Guidelines.description1: Open to students from all academic backgrounds.
Guidelines.description2: Participants can be from any college or university.
Guidelines.description3: Teams can include members from different specializations.

Guidelines.title: Team Composition
Guidelines.description2: Inter-college and inter-specialization teams are allowed.

Guidelines.title: Competition Format
Guidelines.description1: The competition is structured into multiple rounds, each focusing on different aspects of project development and refinement.
Guidelines.description2: Participants will work on real-world problem statements provided by industry partners.

Guidelines.title: Rounds and Duration
Guidelines.description1: Round 1: Idea Submission (1 week): Teams submit their initial ideas and problem statements.
Guidelines.description2: Round 2: Prototype Development (3 weeks): Teams work on developing a prototype based on their submitted ideas.
Guidelines.description3: Round 3: Final Presentation (4 weeks): Teams present their completed projects to a panel of judges.

Guidelines.title: Problem Statements
Guidelines.description1: A set of diverse problem statements will be provided, spanning various industries and challenges.
Guidelines.description2: Teams are expected to choose one problem statement and work on a solution.

Guidelines.title: Evaluation Criteria
Guidelines.description1: Innovation and creativity in the solution.
Guidelines.description2: Feasibility and potential impact of the proposed solution.
Guidelines.description3: Quality of the prototype and final presentation.

Guidelines.title: Awards and Opportunities
Guidelines.description1: Top-performing teams will receive placement assistance and professional development opportunities.
Guidelines.description2: Certificates and prizes for winning teams.

Rules.title: Team Formation
Rules.description1: Teams must register with the specified number of members (1-5).
Rules.description2: No changes to team composition are allowed after registration.

Rules.title: Submission Guidelines
Rules.description1: All submissions must be original and developed during the competition period.
Rules.description2: Plagiarism or use of pre-existing projects will result in disqualification.

Rules.title: Code of Conduct
Rules.description1: Participants are expected to maintain professional behavior throughout the event.
Rules.description2: Respect for mentors, judges, and fellow participants is mandatory.

Rules.title: Intellectual Property
Rules.description1: Participants retain ownership of their projects but grant Stratothon the right to showcase and promote the projects.

Rules.title: Judging and Results
Rules.description1: Judges' decisions are final and binding.
Rules.description2: Feedback from judges and mentors should be used constructively.

Rewards.title: Gold Innovator – 1st Place
Rewards.subtitle: The top-performing team with the best overall project.

Rewards.title: Silver Creator – 2nd Place
Rewards.subtitle: The runner-up team showcasing excellent innovation and execution.

Rewards.title: Bronze Pioneer – 3rd Place
Rewards.subtitle: The third-place team with a strong, impactful solution.

Rewards.title: Participation Certificate
Rewards.subtitle: Every participant will be awarded a certificate of participation.

InternshipPhases.title: Phase 2
InternshipPhases.subtitle: 3-4 weeks
InternshipPhases.description1: Nurturing on Assessment Evaluation Guidance and Upskill.

InternshipPhases.title: Phase 3
InternshipPhases.subtitle: From 5th week
InternshipPhases.description1: Projects will be assigned on the basis of 4th evaluation.

Stratathon2Phase1.title: Kickoff & Introduction
Stratathon2Phase1.description1: Overview: Introduction to the hackathon, goals, and structure.
Stratathon2Phase1.description2: Problem Statements: Presentation of two problem statements with examples.
Stratathon2Phase1.description3: Judging Criteria: Explanation of submission guidelines and rules.
Stratathon2Phase1.description4: Q&A: Session for participants to clarify doubts.

Stratathon2Phase1.title: Team Formation & Tool Setup
Stratathon2Phase1.description1: Team Formation: Participants form teams of 3-5 based on skills.
Stratathon2Phase1.description2: Communication: Set up channels (e.g., Slack, Discord) for coordination.
Stratathon2Phase1.description3: Version Control: Establish repositories (e.g., GitHub, GitLab).
Stratathon2Phase1.description4: Tools Setup: Ensure all necessary software and APIs are functional.

Stratathon2Phase1.title: Brainstorming & Planning
Stratathon2Phase1.description1: Solution Exploration: Teams brainstorm potential solutions.
Stratathon2Phase1.description2: Project Plan: Outline key features, user personas, and technical approach.
Stratathon2Phase1.description3: Role Assignment: Identify team roles (e.g., frontend, backend, data analyst).
Stratathon2Phase1.description4: Timeline Draft: Create a rough development timeline.
Stratathon2Phase1.description5: Outline Submission: Submit project outline for mentor feedback.

Stratathon2Phase2.title: Development Phase 1
Stratathon2Phase2.description1: Core Development: Teams build backend APIs and basic frontend components.
Stratathon2Phase2.description2: Integration: Ensure frontend and backend components communicate effectively.
Stratathon2Phase2.description3: Daily Standups: Teams share progress and discuss challenges
Stratathon2Phase2.description4: Mentor Check-ins: Quick check-ins with mentors for guidance.

Stratathon2Phase2.title: Development Phase 2
Stratathon2Phase2.description1: Feature Implementation: Add advanced functionalities and optimize UI/UX.
Stratathon2Phase2.description2: Testing: Begin unit and integration testing of components
Stratathon2Phase2.description3: Progress Review: Assess timelines and adjust as needed.

Stratathon2Phase2.title: Final Development Push
Stratathon2Phase2.description1: Refinement: Polish UI and enhance user experience.
Stratathon2Phase2.description2: Documentation: Create user and technical documentation.
Stratathon2Phase2.description3: Testing and Debugging: Conduct thorough testing and fix bugs.

Stratathon2Phase2.title: Testing, Debugging, & Deployment
Stratathon2Phase2.description1: Bug Fixing: Finalize testing to identify and resolve issues.
Stratathon2Phase2.description2: Deployment: Deploy the application on platforms (e.g., Heroku, AWS).
Stratathon2Phase2.description3: Final Testing: Verify functionality on the deployed application.

Stratathon2Phase3.title: Project Demo Preparation
Stratathon2Phase3.description1: Presentation Creation: Develop slides highlighting problem, solution, and features.
Stratathon2Phase3.description2: Rehearsals: Practice presentations for clarity and timing.
Stratathon2Phase3.description3: Technical Checks: Ensure demo functionality and compatibility

Stratathon2Phase3.title: Project Demos & Presentations1
Stratathon2Phase3.description1: Presentation Format: Teams present their projects with live demos.
Stratathon2Phase3.description2: Judging Q&A: Judges ask questions to assess understanding and technical choices.

Stratathon2Phase3.title: Award Ceremony & Wrap-up
Stratathon2Phase3.description1: Judging Review: Judges evaluate projects based on criteria.
Stratathon2Phase3.description2: Awards Announcement: Winners recognized in various categories.
Stratathon2Phase3.description3: Feedback Session: Judges provide constructive feedback to teams.
Stratathon2Phase3.description4: Networking: Facilitate connections between participants, mentors, and judges.
Stratathon2Phase3.description5: Closing Remarks: Organizers summarize the event and encourage further development.

Stratathon2Perks.title: Win Prizes And Earn Participation Certificate.

roadmap.title: For 4th year
roadmap.description1: Interview Preparation: Comprehensive training to excel in technical and HR interviews.
roadmap.description2: Exclusive internship opportunity for the top -performing student to gain real-world experience.

careerTestimonial.review: Career counseling opened my eyes to paths I’d never considered. I thought my only options were engineering or medicine, but after the sessions, I found out there are so many fields that match my strengths. Now, I’m excited about my future!
careerTestimonial.name: Raghav Mehta

careerTestimonial.review: The counseling sessions made a huge difference. I didn’t know much about the job market or even what skills I’d need. Now, I’m not just picking a degree—I’m preparing for a career I care about.
careerTestimonial.name: Sneha Patel

careerTestimonial.review: Before counseling, I was stressed and uncertain about my future. The sessions helped me understand my strengths and showed me where I could fit in. It’s nice to feel a bit more in control of my next steps.
careerTestimonial.name: Arjun Singh

careerTestimonial.review: As a parent, it’s tough to know what to tell your child. The career counseling sessions gave us all valuable information and put us at ease. My daughter now has a plan that fits her personality, and we know she’ll be happy with her choice.
careerTestimonial.name: Anita Verma

careerTestimonial.review: I worried that my son was just choosing what his friends were interested in, not what suited him. After counseling, he’s now pursuing something he genuinely loves—and I know he’s on the right track.
careerTestimonial.name: Rajesh Kumar

careerTestimonial.review: Career counseling was a blessing. I had no idea about the current job market or the new fields available. The sessions really helped us understand what skills our child needs for a successful career.
careerTestimonial.name: Sunita Iyer

careerTestimonial.review: The counselor didn’t just focus on academics. They talked about personal skills and interests, which I think is crucial. Now we feel more confident as a family about the choices ahead.
careerTestimonial.name: Manoj Desai
